intro: Mollinedia corcovadensis, commonly known as the Peruvian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests and mountainous regions. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, berry-like fruits that contain seeds. Due to its ornamental value and habitat specificity, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
